title: P-value
text: Recall that the $$p-value$$ is the probability that an event will happen purely by chance assuming the null hypothesis is true. The smaller the $$p-value$$, the stronger the evidence is against the null hypothesis.
speech: Recall that the , p minus value  is the probability that an event will happen purely by chance assuming the null hypothesis is true. The smaller the  p, minus value , the stronger the evidence is against the null hypothesis.
pacedSpeech: Recall that the  , p minus value
is the probability that an event will happen purely by chance assuming the null hypothesis is true. The smaller the   p, minus value

title: Level of significance
text: The level of significance in this instance is $$0.05$$. Our $$p-value$$ is less than that boundary value, therefore there is statistical significance of a lower proportion of patients that developed AIDS in four years when taking the new drug compared to the control group.
